text: Garamond is the name for a group of serif typefaces. They were created by Parisian typesetter Claude Garamond and Jean Jannon in the 16th century, or they are based on his works. The typefaces use serifs. As these typefaces are very well suited for reading, they are often used in printed books. ==Related pages== *Times New roman == Other websites== * == References == Category:Fonts Category:Latin-script typefaces
title: Garamond
